# Introduction

Exploratory data analysis cheatsheet!

# Importing and cleaning the data

## Loading the data

```{r eval = FALSE}
my_data <- read.csv("example_data.csv")
```

## Basic analysis using R commands

A couple of basic commands to examine the structure

* str() - Gives a basic structure with variables names and types
* summary() - Gives more information on variable distributions

## Cleaning up the data types

You can use the following commands to change types

```{r eval = FALSE}
date_vars <- names(episode_df) %in% c(
	"date_of_birth",
	"admission_date",
	"discharge_date",
	"episode_end_date")

episode_df[, date_vars] <- lapply(episode_df[, date_vars], as.Date)
```
